devdoc.details: Shows the difference between storage and memory data locations in Solidity

demonstrateGasCosts().details: Demonstrates gas costs of memory vs storage operationsState Mutability: view (only reads from storage)Gas Analysis: - Memory copy: ~2100 gas for 3-element array - Storage read operations: ~200 gas total for length and element access

returns._0: memLength Length of the memory array (copied from storage)
returns._1: firstElement First element of the storage array

demonstrateMemoryBehavior().details: Demonstrates memory data location behaviorData Location: memory - Creates an independent copy of the array (gas cost: ~2100 gas for 3 elements) - Changes to the copy don't affect original storage - Memory arrays are temporary and exist only during executionState Mutability: view (only reads from storage, doesn't modify it)Use Case: When you need to work with array data without modifying storage

demonstrateStorageBehavior().details: Demonstrates storage data location behaviorData Location: storage - Creates a reference to the existing storage array (gas cost: ~40 gas) - Changes through the reference modify the original storage - Storage modifications are expensive (~20,000 gas per write)State Mutability: (default) - modifies storageUse Case: When you need to modify the original storage arrayWARNING: Directly modifies contract state

demonstrateStructBehavior().details: Demonstrates memory vs storage with structsState Mutability: (default) - modifies storage for the age fieldGas Implications: - Struct copy to memory: ~700 gas - Storage modification: ~20,000 gas for the age field

getStudentArray().details: Returns the current state of the student arrayState Mutability: view (only reads from storage)Gas Cost: ~700 gas for copying the array to memory

returns._0: The current student array from storage

resetStudentArray().details: Resets the student array to its initial stateState Mutability: (default) - modifies storageGas Cost: ~40,000 gas (20k for each of 3 writes)

devdoc.title: Storage vs Memory Demonstration

demonstrateMemoryBehavior().notice: Creates a copy of the storage array in memoryModifications to the memory copy don't affect storage

demonstrateStorageBehavior().notice: Creates a reference to the storage arrayModifications affect the original storage array

demonstrateStructBehavior().notice: Shows how complex types behave with different data locations

userdoc.notice: Demonstrates how assignments behave differently based on data location
